intro: Zinnia lutea, commonly known as the yellow zinnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features bright yellow petals with a dark central disk. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Zinnia lutea thrives in full sunlight and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
